articles.author: JOSEPH KRAUSS and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu joined with a top political rival on Wednesday to create a war-time Cabinet overseeing the fight to avenge a stunning weekend attack by Hamas militants.
articles.title: As strikes devastate Gaza, Israel forms unity government to oversee war sparked by Hamas attack

articles.author: JOSEPH KRAUSS
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — In the three and a half decades since it began as an underground militant group, Hamas has pursued a consistently violent strategy aimed at rolling back Israeli rule — and it has made steady progress despite bringing enormous suffering to both sides of the conflict.
articles.title: What was Hamas thinking? For over three decades, it has had the same brutal idea of victory

articles.author: DANICA KIRKA and AMI BENTOV
articles.description: TEL AVIV (AP) — One of those taken hostage is a grandmother who learned Arabic in hopes of building bridges with her neighbors. Others include 10 members of an extended family, one an elderly man in a wheelchair who requires hospital care.
articles.title: Families in Israel and abroad wait in agony for word of their loved ones taken hostage by militants

articles.author: LISA MASCARO and KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republicans nominated Rep. Steve Scalise on Wednesday to be the next House speaker but struggled to quickly unite their deeply divided majority and elect the conservative in a public floor vote after the historic ousting of Rep.
articles.title: Republicans nominate Steve Scalise to be House speaker but struggle to unite quickly and elect him

articles.author: JULIE CARR SMYTH
articles.description: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Heavier-than-normal turnout is expected Wednesday as early voting begins in Ohio's closely watched off-year election to decide the future of abortion access and marijuana legalization in the state.
articles.title: Abortion rights and marijuana questions expected to drive Ohioans to polls as early voting begins

articles.author: JOSHUA GOODMAN and JIM MUSTIAN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In his two decades as a professional drug snitch, Jorge Hernández was a master of the double cross. He lied to his handlers, threatened to unmask fellow informants and even admitted killing three people during his days as a cocaine runner.
articles.title: Shadowy snitch takes starring role in bribery trial of veteran DEA agents

articles.author: KEN MILLER
articles.description: OKLAHOMA CITY (AP) — The chief justice of the Oklahoma Supreme Court is recommending the removal of a lower court judge who was caught on camera scrolling through social media and texting during a murder trial.
articles.title: Oklahoma Supreme Court chief justice recommends removing judge for texting during a murder trial

articles.author: JOHN LEICESTER
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — The “Mona Lisa” has given up another secret.Using X-rays to peer into the chemical structure of a tiny speck of the celebrated work of art, scientists have gained new insight into the techniques that Leonardo da Vinci used to paint his groundbreaking portrait of the woman with the exquisitely enigmatic smile.
articles.title: Scientists pry a secret from the `Mona Lisa' about how Leonardo painted the masterpiece

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Detroit's three automakers have laid off roughly 4,800 workers at factories that are not among the plants that have been hit by the United Auto Workers strikes, which have lasted for nearly four weeks.
articles.title: Detroit automakers and union leaders spar over 4,800 layoffs at non-striking factories

articles.author: JOSH DUBOW
articles.description: Kyle Shanahan and Mike McDaniel spent years together scheming ways to exploit NFL defenses.Now split apart with McDaniel in his second season coaching Miami and Shanahan in Year 7 in San Francisco, the two offensive coaches have their teams threatening records with their early season domination.
articles.title: The Dolphins and the 49ers are off to record-threatening offensive starts
